arts.ttl: Everton v Aston Villa, Fulham v Leeds, Championship updates and more: football clockwatch – live
arts.sum: Updates from the afternoon’s 3pm BST kick-offs Arsenal v Nottingham Forest – live Share your thoughts with Tom via email Hello and welcome to a bumper* Saturday clockwatch, a festival of post-international-break football that includes five Premier League games. Six if you count the lunchtime game between Arsenal and Nottingham Forest, and why wouldn’t you. A full fixture list is available on our live scores page. We’ll have updates from the EFL, Scotland and beyond, but our main focus is on the aforementioned Premier League matches. We’ll have team news around 2pm, whistles at 3pm and goalflashes thereafter. Arsenal v Nottm Forest (12.30pm) Bournemouth v Brighton Crystal Palace v Sunderland Everton v Aston Villa Fulham v Leeds Newcastle v Wolves Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Everton vs Aston Villa: Premier League Preview, Gameweek 4, 2025
arts.sum: Only four players in the Premier League have scored more goals than the eight of Beto since Moyes arrived at the club. Jack Grealish is likely to start against the club where he first made his name in the game.

arts.ttl: Villa bidding to extend club-record streak in Everton Premier League fixture
arts.sum: Aston Villa will be bidding to extend a club-record streak when they square off against Everton in Saturday's Premier League fixture at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

arts.ttl: ‘Full of Belief’: Chris Sutton Predicts Result of Everton v Aston Villa
arts.sum: Pundit Chris Sutton has predicted the result of tomorrow’s game against Aston Villa. Everton welcome the Villains to BMD following the international break, which disrupted a strong run of form. The Blues have won three on the spin in all competitions, with impressive performances both at home and on the road. Indeed, Sutton insists Everton will be ‘full of belief’ ahead of the game, but states that Villa will return home with a point.
